note.p: Birth: Holker Hall, Lancashire, England (23 July 1833)
Death: Hotel Metropole, Cannes, France (24 March 1908)
Education: Privately; Trinity College, Cambridge. LLD (1862), DCL (1878, Oxford)

Career: MP for North Lancashire (1857-1868); Under Secretary for War (1863-1866); Privy Councillor (1866); Secretary for War (1866 and 1882-1885); Postmaster General (1868-1871); MP for Radnor (1869-1880); Chief Secretary for Ireland (1871-1874); Secretary for India (1880-1882); MP for North East Lancashire (1880-1885); MP for Rosendale division (1885-1891); Chancellor of the University of Cambridge (1892-1908); President of Council (1895-1903); died of pneumonia
Freemason, initiated, as Lord Cavendish (his style 1834-1835) 12 December 1853, passed 19 January 1854, raised 13 March 1854, Scientific Lodge No 105 (subsequently No 88) Cambridge.
The Library and Museum of Freemasonry, ;Freemasons and the Royal Society; Alphabetical List of Fellows of the Royal Society who were Freemasons' (2010), page 18
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1909 vol 82 pp xi-xvii signed by G D L
References: Vanity Fair 27 March 1869, 21 July 1888, 15 May 1902
